description: It is a platitude that democracy is a triumph of liberal civilization. Yet critics have
charged that democratic citizens are ignorant and ill equipped to understand complex
policy issues. This course explores the moral justifications for democracy in light of
major objections and investigates whether there is something genuinely virtuous about the
kind of society it sustains. Students discuss sources in political philosophy, economics,
and political science. Offered periodically. Prerequisite: BTS-T or permission of
